intro: Acmispon mollis, commonly known as hairy blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are hairy and trifoliate, consisting of three small leaflets. Acmispon mollis is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
